intro: Monadenium depauperatum, commonly known as the poor-flowered monadenium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Amaranthaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, particularly in countries like Namibia and South Africa. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit, with small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish or yellowish in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Due to its low water requirements and unique appearance, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant in dry gardens.
